intro: Franseria discolor, commonly known as the white-flowered franseria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and white, forming a rounded cluster. Franseria discolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
